summary: Foreign trade partners retaliated for increased U.S. tariffs in 2018—reducing U.S. exports of certain agricultural commodities. USDA gave affected farm producers $23 billion in 2018 and 2019 to compensate for lost exports. But we found that, for 2019, the way that USDA estimated the value of lost exports resulted in higher payments. This is because, for commodities such as wheat, the baseline export values USDA...
title: USDA Market Facilitation Program: Stronger Adherence to Quality Guidelines Would Improve Future Economic Analyses
